alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 9:30PM CDT until May 18 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Strane Park...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins with water well into the flood plain and threatening the west approach to the bridge at County Road 401. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM CDT Wednesday was 26.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 10.6 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 05/22/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 24.9 Wed 9 pm CDT 22.2 20.1 13.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM CDT.
